items.title: Live: Comanche speeds down river to take Sydney to Hobart line honours
items.description: Comanche has crossed the finish line first, taking out line honours in the 80th Sydney to Hobart Yacht Race, after a speedy race down the River Derwent. Follow live.

items.title: Sending army to protect Sydney's Jewish community 'not off the table'
items.description: Sydneysiders can expect to see more police officers carrying long-armed guns in the weeks ahead, with the premier not ruling out sending troops to protect the Jewish community.

items.title: Man charged with Tim Picton assault granted bail
items.description: A 20-year-old man is granted bail after allegedly assaulting Tim Picton, a prominent Labor Party identity — an attack police prosecutors say may leave him permanently disabled, if he survives.

items.title: Australian cruise ship runs aground off PNG
items.description: The Coral Adventurer has run aground off the coast of Papua New Guinea with more than 120 people aboard, two months after the death of a passenger allegedly left behind on a Great Barrier Reef island.

items.title: SA independent MP Nick McBride charged with assault
items.description: Police say they responded to reports of a domestic assault at a home in South Australia's south-east on Saturday.

items.title: Four Ecuadorian boys left home to play soccer. They were found beaten, naked and charred
items.description: In the weeks before Christmas, four boys under 16 left home to play a game of soccer. Their forced disappearance at the hands of Ecuador's military has been labelled a national "turning point".

items.title: Forget brat summer, the vibe shift is here and it's terrifying
items.description: From the rise of misinformation and AI to escalating political tensions, vast economic disparity, and the erosion of social bonds, the vibe shift is now understood as a deep, unsettling change in our collective reality.

items.title: Why you might want to keep your receipts when you shop in Taiwan
items.description: Most shopping receipts in Taiwan are also tickets for a lottery run every second month by the government to increase tax compliance, and there are some big prizes up for grabs.

items.title: Kennedy Center boss demands $1.5m damages after musician cancels show
items.description: Musician Chuck Redd cancelled his Christmas Eve show days after the White House announced the venue would be renamed the Trump Kennedy Center.

items.title: Police say Tennant Creek death in custody was result of 'medical episode'
items.description: Northern Territory Police say the death in custody of an Indigenous woman in Tennant Creek on Saturday was the result of a "medical episode", while admitting there was no nurse on duty at the time.

items.title: MCC boss defends curator Matt Page after two-day Ashes Test
items.description: MCC boss Stuart Fox staunchly defends chief curator Matt Page after a wild Boxing Day Test finishes within two days.

items.title: Steroid use is 'exploding' in Australia — but quitting is a lonely road
items.description: A rising number of Australians are using steroids. But one expert says a lack of knowledge and widespread stigma make it tough to get clinical support.

items.title: Man charged for allegedly displaying hate symbol tattoos at NSW beach
items.description: A man has been charged for allegedly displaying what police have called "hate symbol" tattoos at a beach in Newcastle.

items.title: Why getting more migrants to swim has benefits for all of Australian society
items.description: Despite wanting to learn how to swim, many from culturally and linguistically diverse communities — particularly adults — face three key barriers to participating.

items.title: Woman dies in glider crash, pilot airlifted to Royal Hobart Hospital
items.description: A woman has died and a man has been taken to hospital following a glider crash at a private airfield in Tasmania.

items.title: Lily didn't want to be blind. Then she met others like herself
items.description: Other people with lived experience of blindness gave ABC reporter Nas Campanella the confidence to navigate life. Her mentee, Lily, is enjoying similar benefits.

items.title: US holiday travel disrupted as snow blankets New York City
items.description: At least 1,500 flights were cancelled across the country as some areas received up to 25 centimetres of snow.

items.title: Why Trump could order more air strikes in Nigeria
items.description: With US President Donald Trump hinting at plans for further strikes on IS militants in Nigeria, here's a rundown on what you need to know about the conflict.

items.title: Sydney stabbing victims 'in a relationship', with 47yo man arrested
items.description: Emergency services were called to a Quakers Hill home just before 5am after reports of a disturbance to discover a woman dead and a man fatally wounded.

items.title: AI is changing after-school parenting for many Chinese families
items.description: AI is becoming a regular presence at homework time in many Chinese households. Experts say where families draw the line matters more than the technology itself.

items.title: Every time Sonya saves a dingo pup, she breaks the law
items.description: When Sonya sees a black-and-tan dingo, she feels a connection to family and Country, but many landholders see them as livestock-killing pests. Can graziers and dingoes co-exist?

items.title: 'Grumpy' seal disrupts summer boat race at popular holiday spot
items.description: A wild seal dubbed "Grumpy" causes some commotion at an annual boat race on the Mornington Peninsula, outside Melbourne.

items.title: Rockingham grapples with new-found growth as AUKUS plans accelerate
items.description: Rockingham in Perth's south is fast becoming a crucial part of the AUKUS nuclear submarine deal, with promises of a big boost in jobs and infrastructure — but it's also leaving residents afraid for their lives and lifestyle.

items.title: Council watchdog under fire over abrupt end to long investigation
items.description: The integrity agency tasked with keeping the local government sector in check is under fire after an ABC investigation raised questions over whether it was properly empowered to carry out its core functions.

items.title: Spanish soccer coach missing after tourist boat sinks in Komodo National Park
items.description: The Labuan Bajo port authority attributes the sinking to high waves of up to three metres, but rescuers say they are "determined" to find survivors.
